question: Based on the given evidence, is the hypothesis 'If Amy is not an Olympic gold medal winner, then Amy is a Nobel physics laureate.' true, false, or uncertain? The final answer should be 'True', 'False', or 'Uncertain'. Only answer 'Uncertain' if the reasoning results from different evidences conflict with each other.

content.source_1: All professional athletes spend most of their time on sports.
content.source_2: All Olympic gold medal winners are professional athletes.
content.source_3: No full-time scientists spend the majority of their time on sports.
content.source_4: All Nobel physics laureates are full-time scientists.
content.source_5: Either Amy spends the most time on sports, or Amy is an Olympic gold medal winner.
content.source_6: If Amy is not a Nobel physics laureate, then Amy is not an Olympic gold medal winner.
content.source_7: Spending the most time on sports relative to one’s other activities does not necessarily mean spending a majority of one’s total time on sports.
content.source_8: Some Nobel physics laureates have also won Olympic gold medals.
